description: Area, perimeter, angles, and properties of 2D and 3D shapes. Focus on rectangles, squares, triangles, and composite shapes.

concepts.name: Rectangle and Square Area
concepts.description: Finding area of rectangles and squares using length x width
common_misconceptions: Confusing area with perimeter (adding instead of multiplying)
Using wrong units (cm vs cm squared)
Forgetting to include all parts in multi-step problems
question_patterns: A rectangle has length {X} and width {Y}. Find the area.
Calculate the area of the rectangular garden/room/field.
example_stems: A garden measures 12 m by 8 m. What is its area?
Find the area of a rectangle with length 15 cm and width 9 cm.

concepts.name: Rectangle and Square Perimeter
concepts.description: Finding perimeter by adding all sides or using 2(l+w) formula
common_misconceptions: Only adding two sides instead of all four
question_patterns: Find the perimeter of a rectangle with dimensions {X} by {Y}.
How much fencing is needed for a rectangular garden?
example_stems: A field is 25 m long and 18 m wide. How much fencing is needed?
Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle with length 14 cm and width 9 cm.

concepts.name: Composite Shape Calculations
concepts.description: Finding area or perimeter of L-shapes, T-shapes, or combined rectangles
common_misconceptions: Not breaking shape into simpler parts
question_patterns: Find the area of the L-shaped figure.
Calculate the perimeter of the composite shape.
Two rectangles are joined. Find the total area.
example_stems: An L-shaped room: top section 8m x 4m, extension 4m x 3m. Find total area.
Find the perimeter of a shape made from two joined rectangles.

concepts.name: Angle Properties
concepts.description: Finding unknown angles using straight line (180), right angle (90), and triangle (180) properties
common_misconceptions: Forgetting angles on straight line sum to 180
question_patterns: Two angles on a straight line are {X} and {Y}. Find the third angle.
In rectangle ABCD, angle ABE = {X}. Find angle EBC.
example_stems: On a straight line, angles measure 65 and 48 degrees. What is the third angle?
A triangle has angles of 35 and 90 degrees. Find the third angle.

concepts.name: 3D Shape Properties
concepts.description: Counting faces, edges, and vertices of 3D shapes; understanding nets
common_misconceptions: Not counting base of pyramids correctly
question_patterns: How many faces/edges/vertices does a {shape} have?
What is the sum of faces, edges, and vertices of a pyramid?
Which net folds into a cube?
example_stems: A hexagonal pyramid has how many faces?
Which of these nets will fold into a cube?

concepts.name: Symmetry and Transformations
concepts.description: Lines of symmetry, rotational symmetry, rotation angles
question_patterns: How many lines of symmetry does the shape have?
Through what angle is the shape rotated?
Which tiles complete the pattern symmetrically?
example_stems: An equilateral triangle is rotated. Through what angle?
How many tiles needed to make a symmetric pattern?

concepts.name: Finding Missing Dimensions
concepts.description: Using area or perimeter formulas to find unknown lengths
common_misconceptions: Dividing when should multiply or vice versa
Using wrong formula for given information
question_patterns: A rectangle has area {A} and length {L}. Find the width.
A rectangle has perimeter {P} and one side {S}. Find the other.
example_stems: A rectangle has area 96 cm squared and length 12 cm. Find width.
A field has perimeter 54 m and length 16 m. Find width.
